articles.author: Maggi Marshall
articles.title: Nearly 800,000 people are impacted by strokes a year. These are the signs you should look out for. - CBS 6 News Richmond WTVR
articles.description: The American Heart Association finds that one in four adults over the age of 25 will have a stroke in their lifetime.
articles.content:
RICHMOND, Va. Oct. 29 is World Stroke Day, a day created to bring awareness to the medical event that impacts nearly 800,000 people annually.

articles.title: Deadly bat fungus confirmed in five Northern California counties - San Francisco Chronicle
articles.description: The fungus behind white-nose syndrome, which has killed millions of bats across North America, has been detected in several Northern California counties.
articles.content:
The fungus responsible for white-nose syndrome, a disease that has devastated bat colonies across North America, has been detected in several counties in Northern California.
